Comments_List: Learned how to write in Devangari script, formal grammar, and speaking in Hindi.
Learned a lot of Hindi grammar and vocab.
This is a good class for people who can't read or write but have a good knowledge of conversational Hindi. I can read and write pretty fluently now after just one semester, which was super cool!
I learnt how to read and write Hindi.
I learned how to read, write, speak, and better understand Hindi. Having had limited exposure, this was amazing to see in the course of a semester.

Strengths: The department is very close knit and caring. There is a lot of work done to emphasize cultural learning and in practice exercises.

Weaknesses: Since the course is heritage, there is a pretty high assumed baseline of knowledge. We frequently skipped through grammar sections because individuals class already knew it.
The strenghts are that it is engaging and taught well.
Strengths - we go through the language step by step. Many interactive activities are used to test our oral ability which is important.

The strengths of the course are all the extra help available to help understand the language since its quite difficult. The only weakness is that the course is a bit disorganized at times, leading to confusion.
I would recommend this course to other students, particularly those that have grown up hearing Hindi, but are unfamiliar with reading and writing.
Very good course. You learn a lot.
Yes! It equips you with the ability to read and write another language.
I definitely would recommend this class if you have had previous Hindi exposure. It goes at a rate thats not too fast and allows people really practice the facets theyre lacking.
